article:
The Browser present the class hierarchy, and also the relations between classes and Data properties.
The browser has the following elements:
The left part of the GUI presents a tree which shows the graph of Owl classes. It can also present the list of found by the tool if the corresponding option is selected
The right part of the GUI presents the graph of the Owl diagram, and a window presenting the annotations on the selected element on the tree
The bottom part of the GUI presents messages about the tool
Clicking on a Class on the left tree will center the diagram on the selected Class.
There are several menus in the browser:
"File": To open an Owl/RDF graph or save the selected graph as a graphML diagram (compatible with the free editor)
"Options": to set the
"Tools": to change the layout of the selected graph
"Help": shows the version of the tool
The toolbar has the following buttons:
elements in the selected model
Zoom or Dezoom the selected graph
Center the selected graph
The File menu has the following elements:
Open Model: opening a Owl/RDF model
Export as GraphML: export the current Owl/RDF model as a GraphML diagramWhich can be opened in yEd
Open in yEd: open the current Owl/RDF model in
The tool does not handle Owl2 representations for the moment. If you try to open a Owl2 model, you will have the following error window:
The Options => Settings action allows to edit the configuration of the tool.
The Tools => Layout actions allows to change the layout of the current diagram.
After opening a diagram, a tab opens in the browser showing:
At the left the structure of the Owl model
At the right the diagram showing the model, and a window presenting the annotations on the selected element on the tree (see for more information)
The structure of the Owl model is separated in four tabs:
The Class structure tab shows the structure of the Class hierarchy:
If you right click on a Class on this tab, you will have the following popup menu:
Show Dependencies: show the of the Class
Copy to Clipboard: copy the Class IRI to the system Clipboard
Export Class: export the Class and its associated Classes / Individuals and Properties as a GraphML diagram
Show Class in yEd: open the Class and its associated Classes / Individuals and Properties in
If you right click on a Package on this tab, you will have the following popup menu:
Show Dependencies: show the of the Class
Copy to Clipboard: copy the Class IRI to the system Clipboard
Export Package: export the Package and its associated Classes / Individuals and Properties as a GraphML diagram
Show Package in yEd: open the Package and its associated Classes / Individuals and Properties in
The Properties structure tab shows the Properties, separated in data properties and object properties:
If you right click on a Property on this tab, you will have the following popup menu:
Show Dependencies: show the of the Property
Copy to Clipboard: copy the Property IRI to the system Clipboard
The Class structure tab shows the annotations tags in the model:
The Properties structure tab shows the Individuals:
If you right click on an Individual on this tab, you will have the following popup menu:
Show Dependencies: show the of the Individual
Copy to Clipboard: copy the Individual IRI to the system Clipboard
If an element (a Class, a property, or an Individual) has comments or a description in the Dublin Core terms schema, then these comments will be shown as a tooltip on the element. For example:
By default the description will be shown in the tooltip, but if there is no description and comments, there comments will be shown instead.
The content window presents diagram showing the model, and a window presenting the annotations on the selected element on the tree.
The Options => Settings action allows to edit the configuration of the tool.
Classes are presented with a Grey background
Individuals are presented with a Magenta background
Data properties are presented with a Cyan background
Classes from other are presented with an Orange background
